gameplay.world

Class WorldGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.world.WorldGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WorldGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    WorldGenerator's role is to take in a level configuration and generate a populated grid based on the given level specifications. To use, create with constructor, then call generateLevel with the desired level, then use getGrid and getActorList to get the relevant information.
    Author:
    mfong8
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getActorList

        public java.util.ArrayList<GameActor> getActorList()
        Get the list of actors operating on the level.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of enemies associated with the level passed into generator

      • getGrid

        public java.util.Stack<GameObject>[][] getGrid()
        Get the grid associated with the input level.
        Returns:
        grid populated with all the gameobjects specified by the level passed into the generate method.

      • generateLevel

        public void generateLevel(Level level)
        Generates a grid and game actor list associated with the level called on generate. Once this method is called call getGrid and getActorList to return the grid and list containing enemies
        Parameters:
        level - the level that is to be loaded as an enum Level
